title: What Does "Babygirl" Mean? Defining the Gen Z Slang

steps.title: â€œBabygirlâ€ is slang for a guy who is cute, sensitive, and a tad naive.
steps.content: â€œBabygirlâ€ is slang for a guy who is cute, sensitive, and a tad naive. The term is a little slippery, but basically, if your man is over 25-ish, confident in his masculinity yet sensitive, a little broody (maybe?), and daddyish-but-still-somehow-innocent, you got yourself a babygirl right there. The term "babygirl" covers a broad spectrum of dude: it has been applied to sensitive sweater-wearers like Paul Mescal, men who flout gender expectations like Harry Styles, celebs with innocent daddish vibes like Pedro Pascal , curmudgeonly middle-aged anti-heroes like Walter White from Breaking Bad , and narcissistic, emotionally disoriented nepo babies like Kendall Roy from Succession . The word is typically used on celebrities and fictional characters, but real-life guys could be babygirlâ€”or a babygirl, since the term is both an adjective and a noun. While â€œbabygirlâ€ for a man is often used ironically, it's still largely a compliment, and not meant to be condescending or dismissive.

steps.title: â€œBabygirlâ€ can also refer to an attractive woman.
steps.content: â€œBabygirlâ€ can also refer to an attractive woman. The term "babygirl" (or "baby girl") is commonly used to flirtatiously refer to a woman (similar to using words like "honey," "babe," and "sweetie" to refer to a woman.) While some women enjoy being called â€œbabygirlâ€ (or â€œbaby girlâ€), others find it condescending and infantilizing. The new meaning of â€œbabygirlâ€ has been celebrated as a way to subvert gender roles by positioning grown menâ€”often very traditionally "masculine" menâ€”as sweet li'l guys worthy of protecting.

steps.title: Gush over your favorite male character or celeb on social media.
steps.content: Gush over your favorite male character or celeb on social media. â€œBabygirlâ€ is commonly used on social media, especially TikTok, to refer to men who are sensitive yet manly and somewhat naive, men who are tough but emotionally vulnerable in a way that makes you want to protect them. For instance, TikTok user @pascalistic captioned this TikTok video of fan fave Pedro Pascal, â€œhe's babygirl your honor.â€ You might use the term to describe the guy generally, or pull it out when heâ€™s being particularly babygirl. E.g., â€œKyle Maclachlanâ€™s giving such babygirl in these instagram photos .â€ The term might be used semi-sarcastically, as in this TikTok describing Godzilla as â€œbabygirl,â€ but itâ€™s nevertheless used affectionately.

steps.title: â€œBabygirlâ€ as a term for men came out sometime between 2017 and 2020.
steps.content: â€œBabygirlâ€ as a term for men came out sometime between 2017 and 2020. Around this time, Wattpad user aradmille uploaded a photoshopped panel from the manga Mob Psycho 100 , in which Shiegeo asks Arataka, â€œWhy does Serizawa call you babygirl?â€ and Arataka replies, â€œHow about we stop talking for a little while?â€ [1] X Research source The word took off on Twitter and Tumblr in August 2021, when users started redrawing the panel with other characters from different fandoms. Most of the photoshops involved one male character asking another male character (for instance, Mario and Luigi ) why someone calls them â€œbabygirl.â€ Internet users began using the term more widely to refer to men generally, creating TikTok reels featuring their favorite babygirl's most babygirl moments. The word was and remains reserved mostly for celebrities and fictional characters. However, any man can be called babygirl if heâ€™s a babygirl.

steps.title: Zaddy
steps.content: Zaddy A "zaddy" is a hot guy (typically an older guy, but it's not hard and fast) who's also stylish and confident, with a hint of daddy-ness. Think Jeff Goldblum, ultimate zaddy. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Sigma
steps.content: Sigma A "sigma male" is basically a lone wolf. Sigmas are guys who are just as successful and commanding as alphas, but they're way more independent and elusive.

steps.title: Softboi
steps.content: Softboi "Softboi," like "babygirl," encompasses a broad spectrum of definitions, but essentially, it refers to a guy who's just very in touch with his feminine side (and who might come off a tad elitist). "Softboi" has also been defined as a subcategory of f*ckboi: in this context, softbois refer to seemingly sensitive men who emotionally manipulate women. (Think TimothÃ©e Chalamet's character in Lady Bird .) [3] X Research source

steps.title: Submissive and breedable
steps.content: Submissive and breedable â€œSubmissive and breedableâ€ walked so â€œbabygirlâ€ could run. Before â€œbabygirlâ€ took off, Twitter user @T4RIG posted, â€œnormalize ğŸ‘ platonically ğŸ‘ telling ğŸ‘ your ğŸ‘ bros ğŸ‘ they ğŸ‘ look ğŸ‘ submissive ğŸ‘and ğŸ‘ breedable ğŸ‘â€ in June 2021. The post garnered more than 92,000 likes and 12,200 retweets in 5 days. [4] X Research source â€œSubmissive and breedableâ€ are descriptors more traditionally relevant to women than men, and the phraseâ€™s virality in this context paved the way for sweet, soft-spoken men to be praised as babygirls.
